en: I'll have exams right after the summer holidays.
zh: 暑假一结束我就要考试了。

en: Our plans for the summer are taking shape.

en: Do you have any plans for the summer vacation?
zh: 你暑假有什么计划吗？

en: During the summer vacation, I made friends with many villagers.
zh: 暑假期间，我和许多村民交了朋友。

en: I worked in a post office during the summer vacation.
zh: 暑假期间我在邮局工作。

en: How much money was saved in preparation for the summer vacation?
zh: 为准备暑假存了多少钱？

en: I delighted in going to his farm during the summer vacation.
zh: 暑假期间，我很高兴去他的农场。

en: Tourists poured into Karuizawa during the summer vacation.
zh: 暑假期间，游客涌入轻井泽。

en: I'm going away for the summer holiday.
zh: 我要出去度暑假。

en: I'm just going to rest during the summer vacation.
zh: 我只是打算在暑假期间休息。

en: Many young people go abroad during summer vacation.
zh: 暑假期间，许多年轻人出国。

en: I'm looking forward to your visit during summer vacation.
zh: 我期待着你在暑假期间的来访。

en: Because it was summer vacation, I took a trip.
zh: 因为是暑假，所以我去旅行了。

en: There is nothing like summer and ice cream.
zh: 夏天和冰淇淋是绝配。

en: The summer vacation is over.
zh: 暑假结束了。

en: How soon the summer holiday is over.
zh: 暑假过得真快啊。

en: I look forward to the summer vacation.

en: The extension of the summer vacation delighted the children.
zh: 延长暑假让孩子们很高兴。

en: I like cold potato salad in the summertime.

en: As the summer has come, so it will go.

en: In summer meat easily goes bad; you must keep it in the refrigerator.
zh: 夏天肉容易变质，你必须把它放在冰箱里。

en: The summer had gone before I knew.
zh: 夏天在我不知不觉中过去了。

en: Summer is gone.
zh: 夏天过去了。

en: Do you like summer?
zh: 你喜欢夏天吗？

en: Summer is the season I like best.
zh: 夏天是我最喜欢的季节。

en: In summer it is essential to drink lots of water when we sweat.
zh: 夏天出汗时，一定要多喝水。

en: The summer is over.
zh: 夏天结束了。

en: My plan for the summer is to go to Europe.
zh: 我夏天的计划是去欧洲。

en: Nothing beats a big glass of beer in summer.
zh: 夏天没有什么比一大杯啤酒更棒的了。

en: In summer, eggs soon go bad.
zh: 夏天鸡蛋很快就会变质。

en: During summers, I used to go to Miami.
zh: 夏天的时候，我经常去迈阿密。

en: There is nothing like ice cream in the summer.
zh: 夏天没有什么比冰淇淋更让人喜欢的了。

en: Summer is the season when women look most beautiful.
zh: 夏天是女性看起来最美的季节。

en: My father implied our summer trip was arranged.
zh: 我父亲暗示我们的夏季旅行已经安排好了。

en: We cannot sleep well on summer nights.
zh: 夏天晚上我们睡不好觉。

en: In late summer and autumn one can see the leaves change colour.
zh: 夏末和秋天可以看到树叶变色。

en: There are more cars on the road in the summer than in the winter.
zh: 夏天路上的车比冬天多。

en: Summer days can be very, very hot.
zh: 夏天的日子可能非常非常热。

en: My summer school dress is blue and white checkered.
zh: 我的暑期学校的连衣裙是蓝白格子的。

en: I was in London most of the summer.
zh: 整个夏天我大部分时间都在伦敦。

en: The summer sun glared down on us.
zh: 夏日的阳光刺眼地照在我们身上。

en: I'm already accustomed to the heat of summer.
zh: 我已经习惯了夏天的炎热。

en: The flowers faded in the heat of the summer days.
zh: 鲜花在夏日的热浪中凋谢了。

en: The summer heat is rolling in.
zh: 夏天的热浪滚滚而来。

en: The store changed hands at the end of last summer.
zh: 这家商店在去年夏天末易主了。

en: The mountains are a lush green in summer.
zh: 夏天，山峦郁郁葱葱。

en: Some people like summer, and others like winter.
zh: 有些人喜欢夏天，有些人喜欢冬天。

en: They lent their house for the summer.
zh: 他们把房子借给我们过夏天。

en: We live in the country during the summer.
zh: 夏天我们住在乡下。

en: She took a job in a store for the summer.
zh: 她找了一份商店的工作，为了过夏天。

en: What's Scotland like in summer?

en: I would like to join the summer camp.
zh: 我想参加夏令营。

en: St Mark's Square in Venice is always swarming with tourists in the summer.
zh: 威尼斯的圣马可广场在夏天总是挤满了游客。

en: I like everything that comes with summer.
zh: 我喜欢夏天的一切。

en: I have to write a paper of more than 10 pages for my summer homework.
zh: 我必须为我的暑假作业写一篇超过10页的论文。

en: We can see a lot of stars at night in summer.
zh: 夏天晚上我们可以看到很多星星。

en: Please conserve water in summer.
zh: 请在夏天节约用水。

en: Grass is luxuriant in summer.
zh: 夏天草木茂盛。

en: The town was deluged with tourists in summer.

en: In summer, European people enjoy long holidays.
zh: 在夏天，欧洲人享受长假。

en: We have much rain in summer but on the other hand we have little rain in winter.
zh: 我们夏天雨水很多，但另一方面，我们冬天雨水很少。

en: In summer, we used to go swimming in the river.
zh: 夏天，我们过去常常去河里游泳。

en: Tourists take over this island in the summer.

en: In summer, we enjoy outdoor sports.
zh: 夏天，我们喜欢户外运动。

en: In summer, they used to play on the beach all day long.
zh: 夏天，他们过去常常整天在海滩上玩耍。

en: In the long summer days she sat in the sun and watched the trees cover themselves with leaves, and the white daisies cover the hill.
zh: 在漫长的夏日里，她坐在阳光下，看着树木长满叶子，白色的雏菊覆盖了山丘。

en: In the summer, people go to the seaside.
zh: 夏天，人们去海边。

en: I often go swimming at the beach in the summer.
zh: 夏天我经常去海滩游泳。

en: It gets hot and humid in summer.

en: Did you go anywhere for the summer?

en: Which do you like better, summer or winter?

en: What do you associate with summer?

en: Summer has come.

en: The summer drew near to its end.

en: Plant these seeds before summer sets in.
zh: 在夏天来临之前种下这些种子。

en: When summer is over, the days grow shorter and shorter.
zh: 夏天结束后，白天会变得越来越短。

en: In England, in the summer, the sun rises at about 4 a.m.
zh: 在英国，夏天的时候，太阳大约在凌晨四点升起。

en: The alternative possibilities are neutrality or war.
zh: 其他的可能性是中立或战争。

en: Take every possible means.
zh: 采取一切可能的手段。

en: I want to go on a journey around the world if possible.
zh: 如果可能的话，我想去环游世界。

en: I'd send my kid out on his own for a while if I were you. A few hard knocks at this point might do him some good.
zh: 如果我是你，我会让我的孩子自己出去闯荡一段时间。在这个时候吃点苦头可能会对他有好处。

en: Some member countries have been lax in abiding by G-7 agreements.
zh: 一些成员国在遵守七国集团协议方面一直很松懈。

en: Was Ms. Kato your teacher last year?

en: Mr. Kato teaches us English.
zh: 加藤老师教我们英语。

en: Mr Kato, who lives in Paris, misses his family left at home.
zh: 住在巴黎的加藤先生想念留在家的家人。

en: Kato asked him many questions about the United States.
zh: 加藤问了他很多关于美国的问题。

en: Kato's class consists of forty boys and girls.
zh: 加藤的班级由四十个男孩和女孩组成。

en: Allow me to introduce Mr Kato to you.

en: Mr Kato was too old to work any longer.

en: Mr Kato is a teacher.

en: I live in Kakogawa.
zh: 我住在加古川。

en: It is difficult to relate to someone who has different values from you.

en: Some stores discount the price.

en: We must cut down on prices; we can't compete.

en: I'll agree to the terms if you lower the price.
zh: 如果你降低价格，我就同意这些条款。

en: The prices are subject to change without notice.
zh: 价格如有更改，恕不另行通知。

en: Prices are subject to change without notice.
zh: 价格如有更改，恕不另行通知。

en: The price reflects the demand.
zh: 价格反映了需求。

en: The price varies with demand.
zh: 价格随需求而变化。

en: Prices depend on supply and demand.

en: The price is double what it was last year.

en: Prices seem to be going down.

en: Price depends on costs and demand.

en: What is the price?

en: The price does not include the case.

en: The price doesn't include consumption tax.
zh: 价格不包括消费税。

en: Observe his facial reaction when we mention a price.

en: Demand for imported cars is increasing due to lower prices.
zh: 由于价格下降，对进口汽车的需求正在增加。

en: Who do you think you are?

en: He emphasized that tens of thousands of people would come to that concert.
zh: 他强调说，成千上万的人会来参加那场音乐会。

en: How many exposures would you like?

en: Do you have any CDs?

en: There are several flowers. One is red, another is white, and the others are yellow.
zh: 这里有几朵花。一朵是红色的，一朵是白色的，其他的都是黄色的。

en: Minutes or hours later Dr. Numata came in and felt Sadako's forehead.

en: How long is the ride?

en: No scam is too outrageous.
zh: 没有哪个骗局是太离谱的。

en: Millions of people can see more games than when they have to attend each one in person.
zh: 与必须亲自参加每一场比赛相比，数百万人可以看到更多的比赛。

en: For how many nights?

en: After a couple of drinks, the guy was feeling no pain.
zh: 喝了几杯酒后，那家伙感觉很舒服。

en: Lately, I've been letting my English go. It seems I'll never improve at it, no matter how many years I study.

en: I wonder if she will recognize me after all those years.

zh: 几年前，得知自己得了肺结核就相当于听到了死刑判决。

en: How long are you going to stay?

en: You might have to eat those words a few years from now.

zh: 你能在荒野中徒步旅行几天而不见任何人吗？

en: It rained for several days on end.

en: How long are you going to stay here?

en: How long will you be gone?

en: How many days does it usually take to get there?

en: About how many days will it take to get there?

en: How long will it take?

en: If I've told you once, I've told you a thousand times.
zh: 我已经跟你说过很多遍了。

en: Having heard it so many times, I can recite the poem by heart now.
zh: 听了这么多遍，我现在都能背诵这首诗了。

en: Having failed many times, he never gave up the plan.
zh: 失败了很多次，他从未放弃这个计划。

en: Many times have I scolded him.
zh: 我骂过他很多次了。

en: He has lied to me again and again.
zh: 他一次又一次地对我撒谎。

en: Some books are worth reading over and over again.
zh: 有些书值得反复阅读。

en: Having lost the game over and over again, he finally gave in.
zh: 输了一次又一次，他终于屈服了。

en: Having visited Rome many times, he knows about it well.
zh: 去过罗马很多次，他对那里很了解。

en: Read it again and again.
zh: 一遍又一遍地读。

en: I tried again and again, but I couldn't succeed.
zh: 我尝试了一次又一次，但我没有成功。

en: After several delays, the plane finally left.
zh: 经过几次延误，飞机终于起飞了。

en: I've seen one many times.

en: Many animals that lived thousands of years ago are now extinct.

en: Thousands of people were milling around in the square.
zh: 广场上挤满了成千上万的人。

en: Thousands of people gathered there.

en: Thousands of people wanted to know the answer.

en: Thousands of foreigners visit Japan every year.

en: Thousands of stars shone in the heavens.

en: Thousands of people were there.

en: Thousands of people visited the city.
zh: 成千上万的人参观了这座城市。

en: Thousands of spectators got very excited.

en: Thousands of people died of hunger.

en: Thousands of Americans have a hard time keeping the wolf from the door.
zh: 成千上万的美国人生活艰难，勉强糊口。

en: Some boats are on the lake.
zh: 湖面上有一些船。

en: As the centuries went by and England became more crowded, the people found their food supply a great problem.
zh: 随着时间的推移，英格兰变得越来越拥挤，人们发现食物供应成了一个大问题。

en: How many staff members filed to change departments?
zh: 有多少员工申请调换部门？

en: How many people in your party?

en: No man can be a patriot on an empty stomach.
zh: 人若肚子空空，就谈不上爱国。

en: No man is the wiser for his learning.
zh: 学问再多，人未必更聪明。

en: No one can be more wise than destiny.
zh: 没有人能比命运更聪明。

en: How many people are in this room?

en: How many children do you have?

en: How many people are there on the payroll?

en: How many engineers took part in the conference?
zh: 有多少工程师参加了会议？

en: How many people?

en: Let no one appropriate a common benefit.
zh: 不要让任何人侵占公共利益。

en: How many people do you think have an ear for music?

en: Some were late.
zh: 有些人迟到了。

en: How many people are now living in poverty?

en: Some brave passengers caught the pickpocket and turned him over to the police.
zh: 一些勇敢的乘客抓住了扒手，并把他交给了警察。

en: We ought to expect some casual visitors.

en: Some boys came into the classroom.

en: Some people tried to dig the treasure out, but they couldn't.

zh: 一些孩子带了花生酱三明治，一些带了火腿，还有一些带了奶酪。

en: Some were playing tennis on the tennis court.

en: Wherever you go, you will find the same thing.

en: I don't know where we'll arrive.

en: Getting nowhere.

en: You can go anywhere you want.

en: You may sit wherever you like.

en: Dozens of young people attended the demonstration.
zh: 几十个年轻人参加了示威活动。

en: Dozens of houses were burned down in that big fire.

en: It rained after it had been dry for many weeks.
zh: 在干燥了几个星期后，下雨了。

en: Many kinds of flowers will come out soon.

zh: 当有人抓住她的胳膊时，她惊恐地尖叫起来。

en: Somebody had drowned her in the bathtub.
zh: 有人把她淹死在浴缸里。

en: What make of computer do you use?

en: He had been walking for hours.
zh: 他已经走了好几个小时了。

en: After being frightened for many hours, her mother finally saved her.
zh: 在被吓了好几个小时后，她的母亲终于救了她。

en: He was worn out after hours of work.
zh: 工作了好几个小时后，他筋疲力尽。

en: I felt tired from having worked for hours.
zh: 工作了好几个小时，我感到很累。

en: It's painful to keep sitting for hours.
zh: 一直坐着几个小时很痛苦。

en: I gazed at the sea for hours.
zh: 我凝视着大海好几个小时。

en: We've been waiting for hours for you to show up.
zh: 我们已经等了你好几个小时了，等你出现。

en: It rained for hours and hours.
zh: 下了好几个小时的雨。

en: I have tried for hours to remember where I put my keys, but it has completely escaped me.
zh: 我花了几个小时试图想起我把钥匙放在哪里了，但我完全想不起来了。

en: It was many hours before he came to.
zh: 过了好几个小时他才苏醒过来。

en: What time does it open?
zh: 几点开门？

en: When was it finished?
zh: 什么时候完成的？

en: "What time would you like that for?" "Two o'clock would be good."
zh: “你想要几点？” “两点钟就好。”

en: A fox is not caught twice in the same snare.
zh: 一朝被蛇咬，十年怕井绳。

en: How late can I check in?
zh: 我最晚可以几点办理入住？

en: What time does this train reach Yokohama?
zh: 这趟火车几点到达横滨？

en: It became dark before I knew it.
zh: 不知不觉天就黑了。

en: What time can you come?
zh: 你几点能来？

en: When should we make reservations?
zh: 我们应该什么时候预订？

en: What time did she check out of the hotel?
zh: 她几点退房的？

en: What time does boarding begin?
zh: 几点开始登机？

en: When do I get there?
zh: 我什么时候能到那儿？

en: What time do you go to bed?
zh: 你几点睡觉？

en: What time did you eat?
zh: 你几点吃的饭？

en: What time does it start?
zh: 几点开始？

en: What time is dinner?
zh: 晚饭几点吃？

en: What time are you leaving?
zh: 你几点离开？

en: What time will the game start?
zh: 比赛几点开始？

en: What time is our train arriving at Hakata?
zh: 我们的火车几点到达博多？

en: What time shall I pick you up?
zh: 我几点去接你？

en: What time do you get up?
zh: 你几点起床？

en: When did you get up?
zh: 你什么时候起床的？

en: When will you come home?
zh: 你什么时候回家？

en: What time does it open and close?
zh: 几点开门几点关门？

en: What time should I leave the hotel?
zh: 我应该几点离开酒店？

en: What time will the bus pick us up?
zh: 巴士几点来接我们？

en: What time and where could we meet?
zh: 我们几点在哪里见面？

en: When should we check out?
zh: 我们应该什么时候退房？

en: What time should I check in?
zh: 我应该几点入住？

en: Can you please tell me what time the train leaves?
zh: 请问火车几点出发？

en: Do you know what time the shop is closed?
zh: 你知道商店几点关门吗？

en: What time did you arrive there?
zh: 你几点到达那里的？

en: What time can I be there?
zh: 我几点能到那里？

en: What time shall we make it?
zh: 我们定在几点？

en: What time?
zh: 几点？

en: What time shall I come?
zh: 我应该几点来？

en: Do you know what day it is?
zh: 你知道今天星期几吗？

en: Do you know what the time is?
zh: 你知道现在几点吗？

en: About what time?
zh: 大概几点？

en: When are you going on summer vacation?
zh: 你什么时候放暑假？

en: What time do you start check-in?
zh: 你们几点开始办理入住？

en: What time will be right for you?
zh: 你什么时候方便？

en: When is it convenient for you?
zh: 你什么时候方便？

en: When will you be back?
zh: 你什么时候回来？

en: The will is as good as the deed.
zh: 有心胜无心。

en: Whatever we may undertake, diligence is important.
zh: 无论我们做什么，勤奋都很重要。

en: Everything eventually gets easier with practice.
zh: 熟能生巧，一切最终都会变得更容易。

en: Nothing is as precious as friendship.
zh: 没有什么比友谊更珍贵。

en: Nothing can prevent her from marrying him.
zh: 没有什么能阻止她嫁给他。

en: Nothing can be gained without effort.
zh: 不劳无获。

en: Resignation is the first lesson of life.
zh: 顺从是人生的第一课。

en: Don't do anything by halves.
zh: 不要半途而废。

en: You cannot have your way in everything.
zh: 你不可能事事如愿。

en: Whatever you're doing, starting off on the right foot is essential.
zh: 无论你做什么，好的开始至关重要。

en: He smoked as if nothing had happened.
zh: 他抽烟的样子好像什么都没发生过。

en: Nothing happened.
zh: 什么都没发生。

en: All things must have an end.
zh: 天下没有不散的筵席。

en: Don't carry anything to excess.
zh: 凡事不要过度。

en: Moderation in all things.
zh: 凡事适度。

en: Try to have a positive attitude about everything.
zh: 尝试对一切事物保持积极的态度。

en: Take a mean position in everything.
zh: 凡事采取折衷的立场。

en: Do your best in everything.
zh: 尽你所能做好每一件事。

en: One has to do one's best in anything.
zh: 人必须尽力做好任何事。

en: You should do your best in everything.
zh: 你应该尽你所能做好每一件事。

en: Keep in mind that there's no royal road to anything.
zh: 记住，世上没有通往任何事物的捷径。

en: Try your best in everything.
zh: 尽你最大的努力去做每一件事。

en: You must not go to extremes in anything.
zh: 你做任何事都不能走极端。

en: Be the matter what it may, we must persevere.
zh: 无论事情如何，我们都必须坚持下去。

en: Whatever may happen.
zh: 无论发生什么事。

en: Should anything arise, she will be prepared for it.
zh: 如果发生什么事，她会做好准备的。

en: Come what may, I am determined to accomplish it.
zh: 无论如何，我决心要完成它。

en: I will stand by you whatever happens.
zh: 无论发生什么事，我都会支持你。

en: Everybody was anxious to know what had happened.
zh: 大家都急于想知道发生了什么事。

en: He felt that something was about to happen.
zh: 他觉得有什么事情要发生了。

en: Whatever may happen, I am prepared for it.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都准备好了。

en: I ordered some new books from America.
zh: 我从美国订购了一些新书。

en: Where's your head at?
zh: 你在想什么呢？

en: What language is spoken in America?
zh: 美国说什么语言？

en: Why did she interrupt me?
zh: 她为什么打断我？

en: Why didn't you tell her?
zh: 你为什么没告诉她？

en: What do you think caused him to lose his job?
zh: 你认为是什么原因导致他失业的？

en: I cannot conceive why she has done such a thing.
zh: 我无法理解她为什么要做出这样的事。

en: Do you know why they stopped talking?
zh: 你知道他们为什么停止说话吗？

en: Why didn't you tell it to me in advance?
zh: 你为什么不事先告诉我？

en: Why am I shooting these guys, tell me, what have they done?
zh: 我为什么要射杀这些人，告诉我，他们做了什么？

en: Why were you silent all the time?
zh: 你为什么一直沉默不语？

en: How come Mary is going on a picnic with him?
zh: 玛丽怎么会和他一起去野餐呢？

en: The reason is because I can speak Chinese.
zh: 原因是，我会说中文。

en: Why do you think so?
zh: 你为什么这么认为？

en: What did you go there for?
zh: 你去那里做什么？

en: Why didn't you come?
zh: 你为什么没来？

en: What do you mean, why don't I ever say it?
zh: 你是什么意思，为什么我从不说？

en: What are you talking about!?
zh: 你在说什么！？

en: Several cottages have been isolated by the flood water.
zh: 几间小屋被洪水隔离了。

en: A casual remark can hurt someone.
zh: 一句不经意的话可能会伤害到别人。

en: How often have you been to Europe?
zh: 你去过欧洲几次？

en: Having failed several times, he tried to do it again.
zh: 失败了几次后，他又尝试去做。

en: I got sucked in on a lot of phony deals.
zh: 我被卷入了很多虚假的交易中。

en: I got several bites, but could not hook a fish.
zh: 我得到了几次咬钩，但没能钓到鱼。

en: How often is it necessary to feed your pet?
zh: 你多久需要喂一次你的宠物？

en: Which station are you going to?
zh: 你要去哪个站？

en: Some of the birds didn't fly.
zh: 有些鸟没有飞。

en: What you're talking about is more important than how you say it.
zh: 你所说的比你怎么说更重要。

en: What's biting you?
zh: 你怎么了？/什么事让你烦恼？

en: What did you buy?
zh: 你买了什么？

en: You have to read between the lines to get the most out of anything.
zh: 你必须理解字里行间的意思才能充分理解任何事物。

en: What are you reading?
zh: 你在读什么？

en: What are you cross about?
zh: 你在为什么生气？

en: What was stolen?
zh: 什么东西被偷了？

en: What was it I left behind?
zh: 我把什么东西落下了？

en: What shall I go in?
zh: 我该穿什么去？

en: It's not what you wear, it's how you wear it.
zh: 重要的不是你穿什么，而是你怎么穿。

en: What're you waiting for?
zh: 你在等什么？

en: What are you concerned about?
zh: 你在担心什么？

en: What's your major?
zh: 你主修什么专业？

en: What are you laughing at?
zh: 你在笑什么？

en: What should I eat?
zh: 我应该吃什么？

en: What trifles are you making a great fuss about?
zh: 你在为什么小事大惊小怪？

en: We disputed for hours about what to write.
zh: 我们争论了几个小时该写什么。

en: You should make sure of the facts before you write something.
zh: 在写东西之前，你应该先确认事实。

en: What should I bring?
zh: 我该带什么？

en: What did you make?
zh: 你做了什么？

en: A penny for your thoughts.
zh: 你在想什么？

en: What do you think you're doing?
zh: 你以为你在做什么？

en: How about telling me what you have in mind?
zh: 不如告诉我你在想什么？

en: What are you thinking about?
zh: 你在想什么？

en: Not knowing what to say, he remained silent.
zh: 不知道该说什么，他保持沉默。

en: Not knowing what to say, she remained silent.
zh: 不知道该说什么，她保持沉默。

en: I'm at a loss for what to say.
zh: 我不知道该说什么。

en: What to say is more important than how to say it.
zh: 说什么比怎么说更重要。

en: What do you mean?
zh: 你是什么意思？

en: Not knowing what to see, I asked him for advice.
zh: 不知道该看什么，我向他请教。

en: What are you going to see?
zh: 你打算去看什么？

en: No matter what he plays on the screen, Tom looks great.
zh: 无论他在屏幕上播放什么，汤姆看起来都很棒。

en: What will you have to drink?
zh: 你想喝点什么？

en: No matter what you do, do your best.
zh: 无论你做什么，都要尽力而为。

en: It's no use trying anything.
zh: 尝试任何事情都没用。

en: What are you about?
zh: 你是做什么的？

en: I wonder what they have in store for us under the big top?
zh: 我想知道他们会在大帐篷下为我们准备什么？

en: My view is different from his as to what should be done.
zh: 对于应该做什么，我的观点和他不同。

en: Why are you so happy?
zh: 你为什么这么高兴？

en: What makes you so sad?
zh: 什么让你这么难过？

en: In doing anything, do your best.
zh: 做任何事情，都要尽力而为。

en: Whatever you do, carry it through.
zh: 无论你做什么，都要坚持到底。

en: And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men.
zh: 无论做什么，都要从心里做，像是为主做的，不是为人做的。

en: No matter what you do, you must follow the correct order.
zh: 无论你做什么，都必须遵循正确的顺序。

en: You should make as much effort as possible in whatever you do.
zh: 无论你做什么，都应该尽最大努力。

en: We need money to do anything.
zh: 我们需要钱才能做任何事情。

en: Whatever you do, you must do your best.
zh: 无论你做什么，都必须尽力做到最好。

en: It is up to you to decide what to do.
zh: 做什么由你来决定。

en: I'm doubtful about what I ought to do.
zh: 我不知道该做什么，心里很没底。

en: Not knowing what to do, I called my mother for advice.
zh: 不知道该做什么，我打电话给妈妈寻求建议。

en: My view was different from his as to what should be done.
zh: 对于该做什么，我的看法和他不同。

en: Nobody could decide as to what to do.
zh: 没有人能决定该做什么。

en: I must think about what to do.
zh: 我必须考虑该做什么。

en: You are sure to succeed, whatever you do.
zh: 无论你做什么，你一定会成功的。

en: Whatever you may do, you must do your best.
zh: 无论你做什么，都必须尽力做到最好。

en: What shall we play?
zh: 我们玩什么好呢？

en: It is clear what must be done.
zh: 该做什么很清楚。

en: What do you do to pass the time?
zh: 你做什么来消磨时间？

en: Not knowing what to do, I stood there silently.
zh: 不知道该做什么，我默默地站在那里。

en: Not knowing what to do, I asked for his advice.
zh: 不知道该做什么，我向他寻求建议。

en: Let me know what you're up to.
zh: 告诉我你在做什么。

en: Not knowing what to do, I did nothing.
zh: 不知道该做什么，我什么也没做。

en: I don't have the slightest idea what to do.
zh: 我完全不知道该做什么。

en: Tell me what to do.
zh: 告诉我该怎么做。

en: What do you want to do?
zh: 你想做什么？

en: Please telephone me when you have made up your mind what you want to do.
zh: 当你决定好想做什么的时候，请打电话给我。

en: May I help you ma'am?
zh: 女士，有什么可以帮您吗？

en: What's eating you?
zh: 你怎么了？/ 什么让你心烦？

en: What's taking you so long?
zh: 你怎么这么慢？

en: What would you like to drink?
zh: 你想喝点什么？

en: I can't understand what you're trying to get at.
zh: 我不明白你想表达什么。

en: I have a very vague idea of what you are talking about.
zh: 我对你在说什么只有一个非常模糊的概念。

en: Not knowing what to say, I remained silent.
zh: 不知道该说什么，我保持沉默。

en: Thank you all the same.
zh: 还是要谢谢你。

en: For some reason or other she shook her head.
zh: 不知什么原因，她摇了摇头。

en: Reflect on your own motives when making a decision.
zh: 在做决定时，反思你自己的动机。

en: Because of some technical problem, a movie was shown in place of the announced program.
zh: 由于一些技术问题，电影代替了宣布的节目。

en: What is most important is your strong will to master English.
zh: 最重要的是你掌握英语的强烈意志。

en: The most important thing is thinking for oneself.
zh: 最重要的是独立思考。

en: Above all, you must take good care of yourself.
zh: 首先，你必须好好照顾自己。

en: I love to jog more than anything else in the world.
zh: 我最喜欢跑步。

en: What I need worst is a haircut.
zh: 我最需要的是理发。

en: Duty should come before anything else.
zh: 义务应该高于一切。

en: The one resource more precious than any other was land.
zh: 比任何其他资源都更珍贵的资源是土地。

en: You should put safety before everything else.
zh: 你应该把安全放在首位。

en: We must put safety before anything else.
zh: 我们必须把安全放在首位。

en: Chiefly, I want you to be more frank.
zh: 主要的是，我希望你更坦诚。

en: You must, above all, be faithful to your friends.
zh: 首先，你必须忠于你的朋友。

en: Best of all, he learns things fast.
zh: 最好的是，他学东西很快。

en: Above all, don't tell a lie.
zh: 首先，不要说谎。

en: Above all, be patient.
zh: 首先，要有耐心。

en: Above all, be true to yourself.
zh: 首先，要做真实的自己。

en: Above all, we must be healthy.
zh: 首先，我们必须保持健康。

en: Above all, try to be kind to the old.
zh: 最重要的是，要善待老人。

en: Above all, watch your diet.
zh: 最重要的是，注意你的饮食。

en: Above all, you must help each other.
zh: 最重要的是，你们必须互相帮助。

en: Above all, I want to see him again.
zh: 最重要的是，我想再见到他。

en: Above all, take care of yourself.
zh: 最重要的是，照顾好自己。

en: Are you sure you haven't forgotten anything?
zh: 你确定你没有忘记什么吗？

en: Not having heard from him, I wrote to him again.
zh: 因为没有收到他的来信，我又给他写了信。

en: That won't change anything.
zh: 那不会改变任何事情。

en: You have nothing to fear.
zh: 你没有什么好害怕的。

en: You have no need to be ashamed.
zh: 你没有必要感到羞愧。

en: It is no use your pretending that you know nothing.
zh: 你假装你什么都不知道是没有用的。

en: Having nothing, nothing can he lose.
zh: 一无所有，他也就没有什么可以失去的。

en: There is nothing to worry about.
zh: 没有什么好担心的。

en: Nothing can force me to give it up.
zh: 没有什么能迫使我放弃它。

en: There is no hurry.
zh: 不着急。

en: I could not see anything.
zh: 我什么也看不见。

en: I have no real intent.
zh: 我没有真正的意图。

en: Nothing's gonna change my world.
zh: 没有什么会改变我的世界。

en: Those who possess nothing lose nothing.
zh: 一无所有的人，也就没有什么可以失去的。

en: Above all, I want to be healthy.
zh: 最重要的是，我想身体健康。

en: Nothing is to be compared to its beauty.
zh: 没有什么能与它的美丽相比。

en: I don't feel like anything.
zh: 我什么都不想做。

en: Having nothing to do, he went downtown.
zh: 因为没事可做，他去了市中心。

en: Having nothing to do, I watched television.
zh: 因为没事可做，我看电视了。

en: There's nothing to do, so I may as well go to bed.
zh: 没什么事可做，所以我最好去睡觉了。

en: Work is preferable to idleness.
zh: 工作胜于无所事事。

en: Don't cry before you're hurt.
zh: 不要没受伤就哭。

en: You can wear my scarf as long as you don't spill anything on it.
zh: 你可以戴我的围巾，只要你别弄脏它。

en: Everything points to his guilt.
zh: 一切都指向他有罪。

en: Those who forget everything are happy.
zh: 那些什么都忘记的人是幸福的。

en: You had better tell me the whole story.
zh: 你最好把整个故事告诉我。

en: He looked as if he knew all about it.
zh: 他看起来好像对这件事了如指掌。

en: Sometimes everything goes wrong.
zh: 有时候一切都会出错。

en: Everything seemed to go wrong with me.
zh: 似乎我做什么都不顺。

en: Everything is now ready for you.
zh: 一切都为你准备好了。

en: You didn't leave me shit.
zh: 你什么都没给我留下。

en: Everything went better than I had expected.
zh: 一切都比我预期的要好。

en: No one shall be held in slavery.
zh: 任何人不得为奴隶。

en: Before everything you should take better care of your health.
zh: 在一切之前，你应该更好地照顾你的健康。

en: What were we talking about?
zh: 我们刚才在说什么？

en: What does this stand for?
zh: 这是什么意思？

en: It is good for nothing.
zh: 它一无是处。

en: For what purpose did he come here?
zh: 他来这里是为了什么目的？

en: Few people are free of care.
zh: 很少有人没有烦恼。

en: What do I have?
zh: 我有什么？

en: What thought do you think had the biggest impact on the English in the Middle Ages?
zh: 你认为哪个想法对中世纪的英国人影响最大？

en: By what authority do you order me to do this?
zh: 你凭什么命令我做这件事？

en: Who are you to tell me to get out?
zh: 你凭什么叫我滚出去？

en: What flower do you like best?
zh: 你最喜欢什么花？

en: Never hesitate to tell the truth.
zh: 永远不要犹豫说出真相。

en: What made her so sad?
zh: 什么事让她这么伤心？

en: What do you play baseball for?
zh: 你打棒球是为了什么？

en: Why did her father go to Japan?
zh: 她父亲为什么去日本？

en: What on earth do you want six copies of the same book for?
zh: 你到底要六本同样的书干什么？

en: What are you working for?
zh: 你在为谁工作？

en: What did you buy this expensive dictionary for?
zh: 你买这本昂贵的词典是为了什么？

en: What do you learn English for?
zh: 你学英语是为了什么？

en: What did you buy it for?
zh: 你买它干什么？

en: For what?
zh: 为了什么？

en: What kind of sandwich do you want?
zh: 你想要哪种三明治？

en: What for?
zh: 为什么？

en: The allusion was not lost on me.
zh: 我明白这个典故。

en: What will you have to eat?
zh: 你想吃什么？

en: Just tell me what you'd like me to do.
zh: 告诉我你想让我做什么就行。

en: I will be glad if I can serve you in any way.
zh: 如果我能以任何方式为您服务，我将很高兴。

en: In fact, I'll even call George at the office and tell him he ought to come home and help out.
zh: 事实上，我甚至会打电话给乔治，告诉他他应该回家帮忙。

en: What a fine day it is!
zh: 今天天气真好！

en: What a good teacher Mr Hirayama is!
zh: 平山先生真是个好老师！

en: How well Mr Hirayama teaches!
zh: 平山先生教得真好！

en: What a dishonest fellow!
zh: 多么不诚实的人啊！

en: What a beautiful rainbow!
zh: 多么美丽的彩虹啊！

en: What lovely flowers!
zh: 多么可爱的花啊！

en: I don't know how to reply to that question.
zh: 我不知道如何回答这个问题。

en: What a big supermarket!
zh: 多么大的超市啊！

en: What a lazy teacher!
zh: 多么懒惰的老师啊！

en: How wonderful a time we have had!
zh: 我们度过了多么美好的时光啊！

en: How well she is singing!
zh: 她唱得多么好啊！

en: How serious I looked!
zh: 我看起来多么严肃啊！

en: What a pity!
zh: 多么可惜啊！

en: What splendid houses they are!
zh: 他们是多么漂亮的房子啊！

en: I am at a loss for what I have to say.
zh: 我不知道该说什么才好。

en: I didn't know what to say.
zh: 我不知道该说什么。

en: Let me have your suggestion as to what I am to say.
zh: 请你给我提个建议，我该说什么。

en: How blue the sky is!
zh: 天空多么蓝啊！

en: He exclaimed, "What a dirty face you have!"
zh: 他惊叫道：“你有一张多么脏的脸啊！”

en: I can't say for sure.
zh: 我不能确定。

en: What an incredible amount of work he has done!
zh: 他完成了多么惊人的工作量啊！

en: I can't say.
zh: 我说不好。

en: I have no words to express my gratitude.
zh: 我无法用语言表达我的感激之情。

en: I sort of understand.
zh: 我有点明白了。

en: Boy, did she have egg on her face when she showed up at the formal party wearing blue jeans!
zh: 天哪，当她穿着蓝色牛仔裤出现在正式聚会上时，她真是丢脸死了！

en: How fast the plane is!
zh: 飞机多么快啊！

en: I must save her at all costs.
zh: 我不惜一切代价也要救她。

en: What a marvelous sight!
zh: 多么壮丽的景象啊！

en: What a heavenly dress!
zh: 多么漂亮的裙子啊！

en: We must prevent war at any cost.
zh: 我们必须不惜一切代价阻止战争。

en: We've got to break out tonight or I'll go crazy!
zh: 我们今晚必须逃出去，否则我会疯掉的！

en: I ache for a sight of the sea.
zh: 我渴望看到大海。

en: I must save the drowning child by all means.
zh: 我必须尽一切努力救那个溺水的孩子。

en: We must prevent the fire from reaching the gunpowder at any cost.
zh: 我们必须不惜一切代价阻止火势蔓延到火药。

en: She managed to learn to drive a car.
zh: 她设法学会了开车。

en: I managed to find his office.
zh: 我设法找到了他的办公室。

en: Will you make every effort to come?
zh: 你会尽一切努力来吗？

en: I'll manage to fit you in next week.
zh: 我下周设法给你安排时间。

en: We just got to first base.
zh: 我们才刚刚开始。

en: I tried everything to keep him alive.
zh: 我尽了一切努力来救活他。

en: I'll get my son to wash my car somehow or other.
zh: 我总会有办法让我儿子洗我的车。

en: I hope I can manage to make both ends meet.
zh: 我希望能设法做到收支相抵。

en: Let's try to arrange something.
zh: 我们尽量安排一下。

en: Could you make time for me?
zh: 你能抽出时间给我吗？

en: Push the job and get it done this week.
zh: 加紧工作，这周完成它。

en: I managed to make myself understood in English.
zh: 我设法用英语表达清楚了自己的意思。

en: What a lovely doll!
zh: 多么可爱的娃娃啊！

en: I think I can handle it.
zh: 我想我能应付。

en: I'll work that into my tight schedule.
zh: 我会把那件事安排到我紧张的日程中。

en: We made it out of there.
zh: 我们从那里逃出来了。

en: Do something!
zh: 做点什么吧！

en: Get up as early as you possibly can.
zh: 尽可能早地起床。

en: Will you manage to repair my car?
zh: 你能修好我的车吗？

en: I was determined to fulfill my duties at any cost.
zh: 我决心不惜一切代价履行我的职责。

en: Catch as catch can.
zh: 各凭本事。

en: Can't you do something to help me?
zh: 你不能做点什么来帮我吗？

en: Please do something about it.
zh: 请你处理一下这件事。

en: I'll be there by eight somehow.
zh: 我无论如何都会在八点前到那里。

en: You should struggle so hard to make this program work.
zh: 你应该努力让这个程序运行起来。

en: I cannot thank you too much.
zh: 我太感谢你了。

en: I beg your pardon?
zh: 你说什么？

en: Not knowing what to say, she just smiled.
zh: 不知道该说什么，她只是笑了笑。

en: I was wrong all the same.
zh: 无论如何，我还是错了。

en: After all, their form of transport produces no pollution at all.
zh: 毕竟，他们的交通工具根本不产生污染。

en: I was at a loss what to say.
zh: 我一时不知说什么好。

en: What a waste of water!
zh: 多浪费水啊！

en: What a waste of energy!
zh: 多浪费能源啊！

en: How slow you are!
zh: 你真慢！

en: So quick!
zh: 真快！

en: What made her do so?
zh: 是什么让她这么做的？

en: You have a lot of nerve!
zh: 你真大胆！

en: Hmmm, how shall I say this?
zh: 嗯...我该怎么说呢？

en: What led you to believe it?
zh: 是什么让你相信的？

en: What a cute little girl!
zh: 多么可爱的小女孩啊！

en: Why me?
zh: 为什么是我？

en: How naughty you are! Stop bothering me!
zh: 你真淘气！别烦我了！

en: Ask me anything!
zh: 随便问我什么！

en: What a good idea!
zh: 真是个好主意！

en: It's to your advantage to learn everything you can.
zh: 尽可能多地学习对你有利。

en: You cannot have your own way in everything.
zh: 你不能事事都随心所欲。

en: We cannot have our own way in everything.
zh: 我们不能事事都随心所欲。

en: You may take anything you like.
zh: 你喜欢什么就拿什么。

en: Call on us in case of any difficulties.
zh: 如果有什么困难，请来找我们。

en: Help yourself to anything you like.
zh: 随便吃点什么吧。

en: Please get whatever you like.
zh: 请随便拿你喜欢的。

en: Jack of all trades, and master of none.
zh: 样样都懂，样样稀松。

en: You can't hope to have your own way in everything.
zh: 你不可能事事如意。

en: Without motivation, nothing can be achieved.
zh: 没有动力，一事无成。

en: It was nothing.
zh: 没什么。

en: I'll do anything.
zh: 我什么都愿意做。

en: Stop making a fuss over nothing.
zh: 别为一点小事大惊小怪。

en: You shall not have your own way in everything.
zh: 你不能事事都随心所欲。

en: Anything will do.
zh: 什么都行。

en: A jack of all trades is a master of none.
zh: 万事通，样样松。

en: Help yourself to anything you'd like to eat.
zh: 想吃什么就随便吃。

en: I am entirely at your service.
zh: 我完全听您吩咐。

en: I'm sure people would live twice as long if they stopped getting themselves worked up over everything.
zh: 我确信如果人们不再为一切事情烦恼，他们会活得两倍长。

en: Eat whatever you like.
zh: 想吃什么就吃什么。

en: What marvelous weather.
zh: 天气真好。

en: What's it made from?
zh: 这是什么做的？

en: Come again?
zh: 再说一遍？

en: I don't care what you say. It's not going to happen!
zh: 我不在乎你怎么说。这是不可能发生的！

en: Holy cow!
zh: 我的天啊！

en: The men will be happy if they get anything back.
zh: 如果他们能拿回任何东西，男人们都会很高兴。

en: I didn't hear what you said.
zh: 我没听清你说什么。

en: What's my book doing here?
zh: 我的书怎么会在这里？

en: What an ambiguous expression!
zh: 多么模棱两可的表达啊！

en: I'm sort of tired.
zh: 我有点累。

en: We'll what?
zh: 我们怎么样？

en: Give me a break. If you have something to say, stop making faces and say it.
zh: 饶了我吧。有话直说，别做鬼脸了。

en: Say, he is no more than a kid.
zh: 我说，他不过是个孩子。

en: What are you going to do?
zh: 你打算做什么？

en: Because the store is so small, he has to wear many different hats, from accountant to stock boy.
zh: 因为店太小了，他必须身兼数职，从会计到理货员。

en: We discussed what to do.
zh: 我们讨论了该怎么做。

en: Come what may, we must remain cheerful.
zh: 无论发生什么，我们都要保持乐观。

en: How many languages can you speak?
zh: 你会说几种语言？

en: For months, he did almost nothing.
zh: 好几个月，他几乎什么都没做。

en: I've been going out with her for months.
zh: 我和她交往好几个月了。

en: Do you have anything to talk about?
zh: 你有什么要说的吗？

en: Won't you give me something cold to drink?
zh: 你就不能给我来点冰的喝吗？

en: Will you give me something cold to drink?
zh: 你能给我来点冰的喝吗？

en: How about something cold to drink?
zh: 来点冰的喝怎么样？

en: I want something cold to drink.
zh: 我想喝点冰的。

en: Would you give me something cold to drink?
zh: 你能给我来点冰的喝吗？（更客气）

en: I want to drink something cold.
zh: 我想喝点冰的东西。

en: Have you thought of any good plans?
zh: 你想出什么好计划了吗？

en: He says "want" when he wants something, and "no" when he does not.
zh: 他想要什么就说“要”，不想要就说“不”。

en: Tell me what you want.
zh: 告诉我你想要什么。

en: I thought you had come on business.
zh: 我以为你是来办公事的。

en: Have you got any plans?
zh: 你有什么计划吗？

en: Are you taking any medicine regularly?
zh: 你有 নিয়মিত服用药吗？

en: A certain problem may come about.
zh: 可能会出现某个问题。

en: Are there any landmarks?
zh: 有什么地标建筑吗？

en: Don't you smell something unusual?
zh: 你有没有闻到什么不寻常的味道？

en: There should be something for us to talk about.
zh: 我们之间应该有些什么可以聊聊。

en: What have you got to say for yourself?
zh: 你有什么要为自己辩解的吗？

en: What's new?
zh: 有什么新鲜事吗？

en: She must have sensed something odd.
zh: 她一定是感觉到了什么不对劲。

en: There must be another way.
zh: 一定有别的办法。

en: I smell something rotten.
zh: 我闻到什么东西腐烂的味道。

en: Let me know if you are in need of anything.
zh: 如果你需要什么，请告诉我。

en: Don't hesitate to tell me if you need anything.
zh: 如果你需要什么，请随时告诉我。

en: Please bring me some medicine for airsickness.
zh: 请给我一些晕车药。

en: What tempted him to propose to her?
zh: 什么诱惑他向她求婚？

en: What made her do such a thing?
zh: 什么让她做出这样的事？

en: What tempted him to come home?
zh: 什么诱惑他回家？

en: If you have some troubles, I recommend you confer with him.
zh: 如果你有什么麻烦，我建议你和他商量一下。

en: Please give me something hot to drink.
zh: 请给我一些热的喝的。

en: May I have something hot to drink?
zh: 我可以来点热的喝的吗？

en: Do you have anything hot?
zh: 你们有什么热的吗？

en: Time will pass quite quickly when you read something.
zh: 当你阅读的时候，时间会过得很快。

en: Lend me some books to read.
zh: 借我一些书看看。

en: I want something to read.
zh: 我想要一些东西看。

en: Are you doing anything special?
zh: 你有什么特别的安排吗？

en: Do you have anything to say in particular?
zh: 你有什么特别要说的吗？

en: Do you have anything in mind?
zh: 你有什么想法吗？

en: Do you have anything to relieve a headache?
zh: 你有什么可以缓解头痛的药吗？

en: We must devise some means of escape.
zh: 我们必须想出一些逃脱的方法。

en: Whatever happens, I'll stick to my principles to the bitter end.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都会坚持我的原则到底。

en: Would you like to leave a message?
zh: 您要留言吗？

en: May I take a message?
zh: 需要我帮您留言吗？

en: What is the news?
zh: 有什么消息吗？

en: Can I please have something hot to drink?
zh: 请给我来点热的喝的，好吗？

en: I want something hot to drink.
zh: 我想喝点热的。

en: He encouraged his son to do something great.
zh: 他鼓励他的儿子去做一些伟大的事情。

en: What is cooking in the kitchen?
zh: 厨房里在做什么好吃的？

en: Is there anything else you would like to eat?
zh: 您还想吃点别的吗？

en: Is it anything serious?
zh: 严重吗？

en: Did you make any New Year's resolutions?
zh: 你做了什么新年计划吗？

en: He's given to going overboard every time he gets a new idea.
zh: 他一有新想法就容易做得过火。

en: We want something new.
zh: 我们想要一些新的东西。

en: Is there any fresh news?
zh: 有什么新鲜消息吗？

en: Give me something to eat.
zh: 给我点吃的。

en: Can I have something to eat?
zh: 我可以吃点东西吗？

en: I want something to eat.
zh: 我想吃点东西。

en: Do you have anything to eat?
zh: 你有什么吃的吗？

en: Bring me something to eat.
zh: 给我拿点吃的。

en: Please give me something to eat.
zh: 请给我点吃的。

en: Please give me something to eat. I am so hungry.
zh: 请给我点吃的。我太饿了。

en: I'd like something to eat.
zh: 我想吃点东西。

en: How about a bite?
zh: 来一口怎么样？

en: Is there anything that I should not eat?
zh: 有什么我不应该吃的东西吗？

en: If something goes wrong, you should attend to it at once.
zh: 如果出了什么问题，你应该立刻处理。

en: Can I borrow something to write with?
zh: 我可以借支笔吗？

en: I want something with which to write.
zh: 我想要用来写字的东西。

en: Do you have something to write with?
zh: 你有什么可以用来写字的东西吗？

en: I need something to write with.
zh: 我需要用来写字的东西。

en: I want something to write on.
zh: 我想要用来写的东西。

en: Give me something to write with.
zh: 给我一些可以用来写字的东西。

en: Give me something to write on.
zh: 给我一些可以用来写的东西。

en: Will you give us a statement?
zh: 你们能给我们一份声明吗？

en: He did not understand what was in the way of his success in life.
zh: 他不明白是什么阻碍了他获得人生的成功。

en: Do you collect anything?
zh: 你收集什么东西吗？

en: Can I help you?
zh: 我能帮你吗？

en: I should have done something.
zh: 我本应该做些什么的。

en: If something does happen, I'll just play it by ear.
zh: 如果真的发生了什么，我就随机应变。

en: Do you have any questions?
zh: 你有什么问题吗？

en: Wire me at once, in case there should be an accident.
zh: 万一发生意外，请立刻给我发电报。

en: There appears to have been an accident.
zh: 好像发生了事故。

en: I need to find out exactly what went wrong.
zh: 我需要弄清楚到底哪里出了问题。

en: I will be able to see you tomorrow unless something unexpected turns up.
zh: 除非发生什么意外，否则我明天可以见到你。

en: Give me something to do.
zh: 给我一些事情做。

en: Do you subscribe to any magazines?
zh: 你订阅什么杂志吗？

en: I think there has been some misunderstanding here.
zh: 我想这里面有些误会。

en: What do you want me to do?
zh: 你想让我做什么？

en: Is there anything I can do for you?
zh: 有什么我可以帮你的吗？

en: May I say something?
zh: 我可以讲几句吗？

en: If you have something to say, say it now or pipe down.
zh: 如果你有什么要说的，现在就说，不然就闭嘴。

en: What's the cause?
zh: 原因是什么？

en: As soon as we find out anything, we will contact him.
zh: 我们一有消息就会联系他。

en: I was conscious that something was missing.
zh: 我意识到少了点什么。

en: I haven't heard from him these several months.
zh: 我已经好几个月没收到他的消息了。

en: You must take up a regular occupation.
zh: 你必须找一份正经工作。

en: I'd like something light.
zh: 我想要一些清淡的。

en: Do you have a plan?
zh: 你有什么计划吗？

en: What's worrying you?
zh: 你在担心什么？

en: Something terrible is about to happen.
zh: 可怕的事情就要发生了。

en: I had a feeling that something dreadful was happening.
zh: 我有一种不祥的预感，觉得有什么可怕的事情正在发生。

en: I have a feeling that something dreadful is going to happen.
zh: 我有一种不祥的预感，觉得有什么可怕的事情要发生。

en: Something dreadful has happened to Miss Davidson.
zh: 戴维森小姐一定是出了什么可怕的事。

en: Ask him if you have any doubt.
zh: 如果你有任何疑问，就问他。

en: What's going on?
zh: 发生了什么事？

en: No matter what happens, I will never change my mind.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都不会改变主意。

en: Come what may, I am prepared for it.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都准备好了。

en: I'll stand by you whatever happens.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都会支持你。

en: We ought to be ready for whatever comes.
zh: 我们应该为即将发生的一切做好准备。

en: He told me that whatever might happen, he was prepared for it.
zh: 他告诉我，无论发生什么，他都准备好了。

en: We should obey the law no matter what happens.
zh: 无论发生什么，我们都应该遵守法律。

en: Whatever happens, please remember I'll stand by you.
zh: 无论发生什么，请记住我会支持你。

en: Come what may, I'm ready for it.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都准备好了。

en: Come what may, I will never leave you.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都永远不会离开你。

en: I'll keep my word, whatever may happen.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都会信守诺言。

en: Come what may; I won't change my mind.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都不会改变主意。

en: Had he known what was about to happen, he would have changed his plan.
zh: 如果他知道即将发生什么，他就会改变他的计划。

en: What would happen?
zh: 会发生什么？

en: It is unexpected what breaks out.
zh: 真想不到会爆发什么。

en: There is no predicting what may happen.
zh: 无法预测会发生什么。

en: There is no telling what will happen.
zh: 无法知道会发生什么。

en: There is no knowing what may happen.
zh: 无法知道会发生什么。

en: Nobody can foresee what'll happen.
zh: 没人能预料会发生什么。

en: There is no knowing what will happen.
zh: 无法知道会发生什么。

en: Had they known what was about to happen, they would have changed their plans.
zh: 如果他们知道即将发生什么，他们就会改变计划。

en: Whatever happens, keep calm.
zh: 无论发生什么，保持冷静。

en: I don't care what happens.
zh: 我不在乎会发生什么。

en: Keep on the watch for anything to come.
zh: 留意任何可能发生的事情。

en: No matter what happens, you must not give up.
zh: 无论发生什么，你都不能放弃。

en: No matter what happens, I won't be surprised.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都不会感到惊讶。

en: I'll go no matter what.
zh: 无论如何我都会去。

en: Whatever happens, you have to stay calm.
zh: 无论发生什么，你都必须保持冷静。

en: What is going on?
zh: 发生了什么事？

en: I demand to know what's going on here.
zh: 我要求知道这里发生了什么事。

en: I sensed what was happening.
zh: 我感觉到了正在发生的事情。

en: I was astonished to hear what had happened.
zh: 听到发生的事情我很惊讶。

en: I wonder what happened.
zh: 我想知道发生了什么事。

en: What happened, Sally?
zh: 莎莉，发生什么事了？

en: What's up?
zh: 怎么了？

en: I explained to her what the matter was.
zh: 我向她解释了是怎么回事。

en: Do you know what happened?
zh: 你知道发生了什么事吗？

en: I cannot account for what has happened.
zh: 我无法解释发生了什么事。

en: Give me an accurate report of what happened.
zh: 请给我一份关于发生了什么的准确报告。

en: How did it come about?
zh: 这是怎么发生的？

en: We need a detailed description of what happened.
zh: 我们需要一份关于发生了什么的详细描述。

en: We were astonished to hear what had happened.
zh: 我们听到发生的事情感到震惊。

en: Something may have happened to him.
zh: 他可能出事了。

en: Something bad's going to happen.
zh: 要出事了。

en: Have I said something to hurt your feelings?
zh: 我说过什么让你伤心的话吗？

en: I feel like eating something sweet.
zh: 我想吃点甜的东西。

en: I want something sweet to eat.
zh: 我想吃点甜的东西。

en: Are there any discount tickets for me?
zh: 有我的折扣票吗？

en: Can you play any musical instruments?
zh: 你会演奏乐器吗？

en: Have you got any baggage?
zh: 你有行李吗？

en: Do you hear any sound?
zh: 你听到什么声音了吗？

en: Please give me something to drink.
zh: 请给我来点喝的。

en: Give me something to drink.
zh: 给我来点喝的。

en: Will you give me something to drink?
zh: 你能给我来点喝的吗？

en: Can I get you something to drink?
zh: 要我给你来点喝的吗？

en: May I have something to drink?
zh: 我可以来点喝的吗？

en: I want something to drink.
zh: 我想来点喝的。

en: I'd like something to drink.
zh: 我想来点喝的。

en: Are you implying something?
zh: 你是在暗示什么吗？

en: Do you have an opinion?
zh: 你有什么意见吗？

en: You must persevere before you can accomplish anything great.
zh: 要成就伟业，必须坚持不懈。

en: What is the matter with you?
zh: 你怎么了？

en: Did you eat anything bad?
zh: 你吃了什么不好的东西吗？

en: Something bad may happen to him.
zh: 他可能会遇到不好的事情。

en: Something wrong was about to happen.
zh: 好像有什么不好的事情要发生了。

en: You don't seem to understand how difficult it is for young people today to believe in something.
zh: 你似乎不明白现在的年轻人要相信一些事情有多么困难。

en: To record something, they used knotted cords made of the wool of the llama or alpaca.
zh: 为了记录一些事情，他们使用由羊驼毛或骆驼毛制成的打结的绳子。

en: If you say that you cannot help doing something, you mean you cannot prevent or avoid it.
zh: 如果你说你忍不住要做某事，你的意思是说你无法阻止或避免它。

en: Give me a ring if you find out anything.
zh: 如果你发现了什么，给我来个电话。

en: What shall I begin with?
zh: 我该从哪里开始呢？

en: Do you have any good news?
zh: 你有什么好消息吗？

en: Come what may, we must do our duty.
zh: 无论发生什么，我们都必须履行我们的职责。

en: Before buying anything, you had better ask yourself whether you cannot do without it.
zh: 在买任何东西之前，你最好先问问自己是否真的不能没有它。

en: Do you have any further questions to ask?
zh: 你还有什么其他问题要问吗？

en: I'll let you know if anything comes up.
zh: 如果有什么事发生，我会通知你的。

en: Show me some others.
zh: 给我看看其他的。

en: What did Bell invent?
zh: 贝尔发明了什么？

en: Is there anything else you want me to do?
zh: 你还有什么要我做的吗？

en: What was invented by Bell?
zh: 贝尔发明了什么？

en: Do you have any pets?
zh: 你养宠物吗？

en: I'll give you a present.
zh: 我会送你一件礼物。

en: The doctors said he would never again be able to walk without some support.
zh: 医生说他再也不能在没有任何支撑的情况下走路了。

en: Complaining about something is one way to adapt yourself to a new environment.
zh: 抱怨某事是使自己适应新环境的一种方式。

en: Can't we use a simile here?
zh: 我们这里能用个明喻吗？

en: I saw something very bright fly across the night sky.
zh: 我看到一个非常明亮的东西划过夜空。

en: What is missing?
zh: 缺少什么？

en: Something's got to give.
zh: 总得做出让步。

en: Would you like anything to eat?
zh: 你想吃点什么吗？

en: What made you so dissatisfied?
zh: 什么让你这么不满意？

en: What is in the desk?
zh: 桌子里有什么？

en: What makes you so dissatisfied?
zh: 什么让你这么不满意？

en: Don't you have anything to do?
zh: 你没事做吗？

en: What is over there?
zh: 那边有什么？

en: Do you play any sports?
zh: 你做运动吗？

en: Did you make anything I can start on now?
zh: 你做了什么我现在可以开始做的吗？

en: I have to do something.
zh: 我必须要做点什么。

en: Something must be done!
zh: 必须要做点什么！

en: Let's play something.
zh: 我们玩点什么吧。

en: If there is anything you want, don't hesitate to ask me.
zh: 如果你有什么想要的，别犹豫，尽管问我。

en: Will you leave a message?
zh: 你要留言吗？

en: Do you have anything further to say?
zh: 你还有什么要说的吗？

en: Lend me something with which to cut this.
zh: 借我个能用来剪这个的东西。

en: Something stinks here.
zh: 这里有什么东西发臭了。

en: Lend me something with which to cut the string.
zh: 借我个能用来剪绳子的东西。

en: Be sure to get in touch with me, if there is anything I can do for you.
zh: 如果有什么我能为你做的，一定要联系我。

en: Don't you smell something burning in the next room?
zh: 你有没有闻到隔壁房间有什么东西烧焦的味道？

en: I felt something crawling on my back.
zh: 我感觉有什么东西在我背上爬。

en: I heard something fall to the ground.
zh: 我听到有什么东西掉在地上了。

en: Something went off with a loud noise.
zh: 有什么东西发出巨响。

en: I felt something touch my feet.
zh: 我感觉有什么东西碰到了我的脚。

en: If anything is sacred the human body is sacred.
zh: 如果有什么是神圣的，那人体就是神圣的。

en: I smell something burning.
zh: 我闻到有什么东西烧焦了。

en: I felt something crawling up my arm.
zh: 我感觉有什么东西爬上了我的胳膊。

en: Something is being looked for.
zh: 正在寻找什么东西。

en: It's no good waiting for something to happen; you must take action at once.
zh: 等待事情发生是没用的，你必须立刻采取行动。

en: Has anything strange happened?
zh: 发生什么奇怪的事情了吗？

en: Something happened and he couldn't keep his promise.
zh: 发生了一些事情，他无法遵守承诺。

en: I hope I can be of some help to you.
zh: 我希望我能帮到你。

en: Can I do anything for you?
zh: 我能为你做些什么吗？

en: I told her that if I could be of any use I would be glad to help.
zh: 我告诉她，如果我能帮上忙，我很乐意帮忙。

en: What shall I do for you?
zh: 我该为你做些什么呢？

en: If you find an interesting book, please buy it for me.
zh: 如果你找到一本有趣的书，请帮我买下来。

en: Lend me something interesting to read.
zh: 借我一些有趣的东西看看。

en: You should put something in your stomach before you go.
zh: 你应该在走之前吃点东西垫垫肚子。

en: Do we have anything I can snack on?
zh: 我们有什么可以当零食吃吗？

en: Go and see for yourself what has happened.
zh: 你自己去看看发生了什么事。

en: Something strange caught my eye.
zh: 一些奇怪的东西引起了我的注意。

en: What makes you laugh like that?
zh: 什么事让你笑成这样？

en: Press the red button if something strange happens.
zh: 如果发生什么奇怪的事情，请按红色按钮。

en: What are you laughing at? It's a fact. No kidding!
zh: 你笑什么？这是事实。不开玩笑！

en: What do you suggest?
zh: 你有什么建议？

en: I feel that something is wrong.
zh: 我感觉有些不对劲。

en: Have you found any good solution?
zh: 你找到什么好的解决方案了吗？

en: I need some good advice.
zh: 我需要一些好的建议。

en: I had a hunch something pleasant was going to happen.
zh: 我预感到会有什么愉快的事情发生。

en: What's the good news?
zh: 有什么好消息吗？

en: What kind of part-time job do you have?
zh: 你做什么样的兼职工作？

en: What made you come here?
zh: 什么让你来这里的？

en: I will be glad, if I can be of any service to you.
zh: 如果我能帮到您，我将非常高兴。

en: I am wondering if I could be of any service to you.
zh: 我想知道我是否能帮到您。

en: Is there anything you can do?
zh: 有什么你能做的吗？

en: What led you to believe so?
zh: 是什么让您这样认为？

en: Is there anything that I can do for you?
zh: 有什么我可以为您效劳的吗？

en: I wish that I could give you something.
zh: 我希望我能给您一些东西。

en: What is it that "isn't only you"?
zh: “不仅仅是你”的是什么？

en: Nothing can ever stagger her belief.
zh: 没有什么能动摇她的信念。

en: Nothing will stop his going.
zh: 没有什么能阻止他去。

en: What prevented you from coming to the concert?
zh: 是什么阻止您来听音乐会？

en: I shall not change my mind, whatever happens.
zh: 无论发生什么事，我都不会改变主意。

en: Hey, what happened?
zh: 嘿，发生什么事了？

en: Please keep me informed.
zh: 请随时告知我情况。

en: If something happens, feel free to call me.
zh: 如果发生什么事，请随时给我打电话。

en: I have some idea of what happened.
zh: 我对发生的事情略知一二。

en: Please tell me what happened off the record, of course.
zh: 请告诉我发生了什么，当然，这是非正式的。

en: Is anything up?
zh: 有什么事吗？

en: Anything new?
zh: 有什么新鲜事吗？

en: Did you notice any change?
zh: 您注意到什么变化了吗？

en: Well, you have only to ask for his help.
zh: 嗯，你只需要请求他的帮助。

en: There is no point in pretending to be sick.
zh: 假装生病毫无意义。

en: We cannot conceive science without a hypothesis.
zh: 没有假设，我们就无法构思科学。

en: I have false nearsightedness.
zh: 我有假性近视。

en: Attached is the tentative agenda.
zh: 附件是暂定议程。

en: You'll need a temporary bridge.
zh: 你需要一个临时牙桥。

en: If it were to rain tomorrow, the match would be postponed.
zh: 如果明天下雨，比赛就会延期。

en: If you were to win the lottery, what would you buy with the money?
zh: 如果你中了彩票，你会用这笔钱买什么？

en: Were the earth to stop revolving, what do you suppose would happen?
zh: 如果地球停止转动，你认为会发生什么？

en: If the sun were to rise in the west, I wouldn't change my mind.
zh: 如果太阳从西边升起，我也不会改变我的想法。

en: What would you do if war were to break out?
zh: 如果爆发战争，你会怎么做？

en: If I were to be born again, I would be a musician.
zh: 如果我能再次出生，我想成为一名音乐家。

en: If I were to tell you the truth, you would be surprised.
zh: 如果我告诉你真相，你会很惊讶。

en: If I should be late getting home, please don't wait up for me.
zh: 如果我回家晚了，请不要等我。

en: If we were to live on the moon, how large would the earth look?
zh: 如果我们住在月球上，地球看起来会有多大？

en: Were I to die, who would look after my children?
zh: 如果我死了，谁会照顾我的孩子？

en: If I were you, I would go home and take a good rest.
zh: 如果我是你，我会回家好好休息。

en: Even if I grant that what you say is true, it is no excuse.
zh: 即使我承认你说的是真的，这也不是借口。

en: Granted that you are right, we still have to persuade him first.
zh: 就算你是对的，我们仍然需要先说服他。

en: If I were to go abroad, I would go to France.
zh: 如果我要出国，我会去法国。

en: If he wants to succeed at all, he must work harder.
zh: 如果他想成功，就必须更加努力。

en: Whatever is worth doing at all, is worth doing well.
zh: 凡是值得做的事，都值得好好做。

en: Granting that it is so, what follows?
zh: 就算这样，那又怎么样呢？

en: If I were to tell you the whole truth, you would be amazed.
zh: 如果我告诉你全部真相，你会感到震惊。

en: If UFOs were to attack the earth, what would become of us?
zh: 如果不明飞行物攻击地球，我们会怎么样？

en: Fossil fuels won't be available forever.
zh: 化石燃料不会永远存在。

en: I got a rash from cosmetics.
zh: 我对化妆品过敏，起了疹子。

en: Fossil fuel prices shot through the roof.
zh: 化石燃料价格飞涨。

en: Ayako's skin is sensitive to chemicals.
zh: 绫子的皮肤对化学物质很敏感。

en: Chemical products account for approximately two-thirds of our exports.
zh: 化学产品约占我们出口的三分之二。

en: Chemical companies are waiting until everything dies down before reinvesting.
zh: 化工公司正在等待一切平静下来后再进行再投资。

en: I have some acquaintance with chemistry.
zh: 我对化学略知一二。

en: I would like to consider the implications we can draw from the application of Emmet's theory to chemistry.
zh: 我想考虑一下将埃米特理论应用于化学可能产生的意义。

en: He is a mean fellow.
zh: 他是个卑鄙的家伙。

en: Here's some medicine for diarrhea.
zh: 这是治疗腹泻的药。

en: I have a touch of diarrhea.
zh: 我有点拉肚子。

en: I have diarrhea.
zh: 我拉肚子。

en: My lower abdomen feels bloated.
zh: 我的下腹部感觉胀胀的。

en: He haunts the lowest resorts.
zh: 他经常出没于最下等的场所。

en: Did you do your homework? The meeting is only two days away.
zh: 你做作业了吗？会议只有两天了。

en: I got soaked to the skin.
zh: 我浑身湿透了。

en: You can wear your undershirt.
zh: 你可以穿你的内衣。

en: Translate the underlined part.
zh: 翻译划线部分。

en: Correct the underlined words.
zh: 更正划线的词语。

en: Translate the underlined sentences.
zh: 翻译划线的句子。

en: The drain is running freely.
zh: 排水管畅通无阻。

en: The drains are blocked up.
zh: 排水管堵塞了。

en: The boarders are now away on vacation.
zh: 寄宿生现在都去度假了。

en: A bad workman quarrels with his tools.
zh: 拙匠常怪工具差。

en: Take care not to make a foolish move.
zh: 小心不要做出愚蠢的举动。

en: A bad workman complains of his tools.
zh: 拙匠常怪工具差。

en: A bad workman always blames his tools.
zh: 拙匠总是抱怨工具不好。

en: We wish to advise you of the following price reductions.
zh: 我们谨此通知您以下降价信息。

en: We shipped the following to you last week.
zh: 我们上周已将以下物品发货给您。

en: I'd like a quote on the following.
zh: 我想询价以下物品。

en: Simply follow the instructions below, and in no time you will be printing full color documents just as easily and quickly as black and white.
zh: 只需按照以下说明操作，您很快就能像打印黑白文档一样轻松快捷地打印全彩色文档。

en: The Representative said he will put a brake on spending.
zh: 这位代表说他会控制支出。

en: The House cut the budget for foreign aid.
zh: 众议院削减了对外援助的预算。

en: The Congressmen rammed the bill through committee.
zh: 国会议员们在委员会强行通过了这项法案。

en: Go downstairs and have a wash.
zh: 下楼洗漱一下。

en: See below.
zh: 见下文。

en: Can you see something red down below?
zh: 你能看到下面有什么红色的东西吗？

en: Sign at the bottom, please.
zh: 请在底部签名。

en: Turn down the volume, please.
zh: 请把音量调小。

en: Reading aloud was a great effort to him.
zh: 大声朗读对他来说很费力。

en: What passion cannot music raise and quell?
zh: 音乐能激起和抑制什么样的激情呢？

en: I hope there are some music clubs.
zh: 我希望有一些音乐俱乐部。

en: I am interested in listening to music.
zh: 我对听音乐感兴趣。

en: Not a sound was to be heard in the concert hall.
zh: 音乐厅里听不到一点声音。

en: The concert was well attended.
zh: 这次音乐会出席人数很多。

en: The concert was a great success.
zh: 这次音乐会非常成功。

en: The concert will take place next Sunday.
zh: 音乐会将于下周日举行。

en: The concert concluded with the national anthem.
zh: 音乐会在国歌声中结束。

en: There were many late arrivals at the concert.
zh: 音乐会迟到的人很多。

en: The musician shook his head and pushed his little piano away.
zh: 音乐家摇了摇头，把他的小钢琴推开了。

en: A musician can appreciate small differences in sounds.
zh: 音乐家可以欣赏声音中的细微差别。

en: Musicians are usually sensitive to criticism.
zh: 音乐家通常对批评很敏感。

en: Did you come from a musical family?
zh: 你来自一个音乐世家吗？

en: The musician left his family poor.
zh: 这位音乐家去世后，他的家人很穷。

en: Do you know when the musician will come here?
zh: 你知道这位音乐家什么时候来这里吗？

en: Who that understands music could say his playing was good?
zh: 谁懂音乐会说他演奏得好呢？

en: I came to this country for the purpose of studying music.
zh: 我来这个国家的目的是学习音乐。

en: I cheered myself up by listening to music.
zh: 我听音乐来让自己振作起来。

en: Try to reproduce the music in your mind.
zh: 试着在你的脑海中重现这段音乐。

en: It is a lot of fun to listen to music.
zh: 听音乐是很有趣的。

en: Do you like listening to music or singing songs?
zh: 你喜欢听音乐还是唱歌？

en: I listen to music.
zh: 我听音乐。

en: Let's listen to some music.
zh: 我们来听点音乐吧。

en: Music has settled her nerves.
zh: 音乐使她平静下来。

en: Music has charms to soothe a savage breast.
zh: 音乐具有安抚野蛮心灵的魅力。

en: Few things give us as much pleasure as music.
zh: 很少有东西能像音乐一样给我们带来如此多的快乐。

en: Music gives sound to fury, shape to joy.
zh: 音乐赋予愤怒以声音，赋予快乐以形态。

en: Music feeds our imagination.
zh: 音乐滋养我们的想象力。

en: Music is a common speech for humanity.
zh: 音乐是人类共同的语言。

en: Music gratifies the ears.
zh: 音乐使人悦耳。

en: Music makes our life happy.
zh: 音乐使我们的生活幸福。

en: The music added to our enjoyment.
zh: 音乐增添了我们的乐趣。

en: Music affords us much pleasure.
zh: 音乐给我们带来很多快乐。

en: Music surrounds our lives like air.
zh: 音乐像空气一样环绕着我们的生活。

en: Music moves the feelings.
zh: 音乐触动人的情感。

en: Are you fond of music?
zh: 你喜欢音乐吗？

en: Nobody is equal to this young woman in the field of music.
zh: 在音乐领域，没有人能比得上这位年轻女子。

en: Our music teacher advised me to visit Vienna.
zh: 我们的音乐老师建议我去维也纳看看。

en: The importance of music is underrated.
zh: 音乐的重要性被低估了。

en: You have good taste in music.
zh: 你对音乐很有品味。

en: Musical talent usually blooms at an early age.
zh: 音乐天赋通常在很小的时候就显现出来。

en: Musical talent can be developed if it's properly trained.
zh: 如果音乐天赋得到适当的训练，就可以被培养出来。

en: Talent for music runs in their blood.
zh: 他们的血液里流淌着音乐天赋。

en: Who that understands music could say his playing is good?
zh: 哪个懂音乐的人会说他弹得好呢？

en: How do I fix the volume?
zh: 我该如何调整音量？

en: Music is universal.
zh: 音乐是无国界的。

en: They were dancing with the music.
zh: 他们伴随着音乐跳舞。

en: With regards to music, he is one of the most famous critics.
zh: 说到音乐，他是最著名的评论家之一。

en: Tastes in music vary from person to person.
zh: 每个人对音乐的品味都不同。

en: Music and art can greatly contribute to the enjoyment of life.
zh: 音乐和艺术可以极大地丰富生活乐趣。

en: Talking of music, what kind of music do you like?
zh: 说到音乐，你喜欢哪种音乐？

en: When it comes to music I have no ear for it.
zh: 说到音乐，我没有音乐细胞。

en: In music or speaking, a pause is frequently used for dramatic effect.
zh: 在音乐或说话中，停顿经常被用来产生戏剧效果。

en: The music made the show.
zh: 音乐使这场演出大放异彩。

en: I hear music.
zh: 我听到音乐。

en: He yields to nobody in love of music.
zh: 在对音乐的热爱上，他不输给任何人。

en: Above the music, I could hear her crying.
zh: 在音乐声之上，我能听到她在哭泣。

en: Were it not for music, the world would be a dull place.
zh: 如果没有音乐，世界将会是一个沉闷的地方。

en: If not for music, the world would be a dull place.
zh: 如果没有音乐，世界将会是一个沉闷的地方。

en: Still waters run deep.
zh: 静水流深。

en: No music, no life.
zh: 没有音乐，就没有生命。

en: Don't make any noise or you'll scare the birds away.
zh: 别发出任何声音，否则你会把鸟吓跑的。

en: Don't make any noise, I'm studying.
zh: 别发出任何声音，我在学习。

en: Don't make a noise.
zh: 别发出声音。

en: Can you keep the noise down?
zh: 你能小声点吗？

en: Leaves were dropping silently to the ground.
zh: 树叶静静地飘落到地上。
